content.p: For students who are seeking or have been granted asylum in the UK. These scholarships aim to help asylum seekers and refugees overcome the financial barriers associated with attending university. To receive an award, you must meet specific eligibility criteria, which are outlined on the individual pages below. Eligibility is assessed using an online application and guidance for this is released closer to the application date. If you receive the award, you will not have to pay back the funds after you graduate. Scholarship for asylum seekers Scholarships and bursaries For students with a household income between £0-£35,000 as assessed by student finance To encourage potential in students from lower-income backgrounds or who have faced significant difficulties For UK students with personal circumstances or backgrounds that may have impacted academic potential Competitive funding opportunities based on a range of factors, such as financial need, academic potential or non-academic skills Please refer to our Data Protection and Confidentiality Statement - for anyone who makes an application for funding from the Funding & Financial Support Team. If you’re looking for more information, please head to our help and support hub, where you can find frequently asked questions or details of how to make an enquiry.
